node.title: Three weeks on, Suzzane still doesn't know how her sister died in custody
node.alt: Suzzane Calgaret holds a serious expression as she stands in front of the Coroners Court of Victoria.
node.description: The family of a 30-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody issues a plea for answers, as a coronial inquest explores whether an opioid dose given by prison authorities could have played a role.
node.content:
["The family of an Aboriginal woman who died in police custody have issued a plea for answers, as a coronial inquest explores whether an opioid dose given to her by prison health workers may have played a role.", "WARNING:\u00a0Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers\u00a0are advised that the following article contains an image of a person who has passed.", "The Coroners Court of Victoria was told\u00a0the 30-year-old woman, whose family requested she be referred to as Ms Calgaret, was living in a reintegration\u00a0unit of the Dame Phyllis Frost Centre last month when she was found by her sister, unresponsive, one morning.", "Staff quickly declared a medical\u00a0emergency and Ms Calgaret was taken to Sunshine Hospital where scans showed she had suffered brain damage from a lack of oxygen.", "The hospital put her on life support in intensive care for several days, before she passed away, surrounded by family, on November 29.", "In a directions hearing on Friday, coroner Sarah Gebert\u00a0said Ms Calgaret's cause of death was yet to be determined.", "However, counsel assisting the coroner said the investigation would explore whether a dose of an opioid drug given to Ms Calgaret by the prison's health workers was relevant.", "The coroner was told\u00a0Ms Calgaret was given her first weekly 8-milligram\u00a0dose of buprenorphine on November 22, the day before she was discovered unresponsive by her sister.", "", "
Ms Calgaret was remembered by her family as a \"kind, caring and loveable person\".(Supplied: Victorian Aboriginal Legal Service)
", "She was also given paracetamol and ibuprofen later that night for a toothache she had after undergoing a dental extraction the day before.", "CCTV footage from the prison and analysis of a blood sample are expected to form part of a brief of evidence due to be handed to the coroner in April next year.", "
Grieving family calls for answers over sudden loss of loving mother
", "The Yamatji, Noongar, Wongi and Pitjantjatjara mother of four\u00a0was remembered by her sister, Suzzane Calgaret, as a \"kind, caring and lovable person\".", "\"I loved my sister. We were best friends and soulmates. She was my right arm, and I was her left,\" Suzzane said.", "", "
Suzzane Calgaret, third from left,\u00a0was supported by family and friends during Friday's coronial hearing into her sister's death in custody.(ABC News: Dylan Anderson)
", "\"She loved her children so much. They were the loves of her life. She also loved her partner, Zulli.", "\"She loved her friends and had a lot of friends. She was excited to see all of them when\u00a0she got out.\"", "Suzzane said discovering her sister unconscious in prison had been heartbreaking and the family needed answers.", "\"Why did her crime make the headlines but she dies and it all goes unnoticed?\" she asked.", "Ms Calgaret's mother, Aunty Jenny Calgaret, said her daughter was like \"an old-mother-hen-type person\", who extended kindness to everyone in the family who needed a hand.", "\"She was the person that kept our family together, kept it going,\" Aunty Jenny said.", "\"We can't replace her. We\u00a0will always miss her.\"", "Victorian Aboriginal Legal Service CEO Nerita Waight said Ms Calgaret's passing in custody highlighted systemic issues in the state's prison system.", "\"How many more Aboriginal women will die at the Dame Phyllis Frost Centre prison before we\u00a0put rehabilitation and reintegration above punishment,\" she said.", "\"Many of the Aboriginal women\u00a0incarcerated are there due to distressing circumstances such as family violence, poverty and\u00a0systemic racism, and, rather than supporting them to be safe and successful in community, we\u00a0lock them away where they cannot be seen or heard.\"", "The Andrews government signed a construction contract\u00a0for an $188.9 million expansion of the Dame Phyllis Frost Centre earlier this year, to add 106 new beds.", "", "
Protesters last week daubed red dye onto the sign at Dame Phyllis Frost Centre, as they expressed anger over the young woman's death in custody.(ABC News: Joseph Dunstan)
", "Ms Waight said the government was too focused on prison expansions and urged it to urgently reform the state's bail laws, which the service said were\u00a0disproportionately hurting Aboriginal women after they were tightened in response to the 2017 Bourke Street attack.", "\"If we want to invest in communities, then we should invest in communities, not prisons,\" she said.", "\"Aboriginal people have survived 230 years of colonisation because of our resilience, because of our\u00a0ability to innovate and deliver innovative solutions for community that work and are more cost-effective [solutions] than prisons.", "\"If the state would invest in communities the way [it does in] prisons, we\u00a0would see meaningful change in society.\"", "Ms Calgaret was serving a sentence for armed robbery when she died and was due to be released in February 2022.", "
Friends rally in protest outside prison
", "Earlier this month, a few dozen protesters gathered outside the Dame Phyllis Frost Centre to express their grief and anger, calling\u00a0for an overhaul of the state's criminal justice system.", "", "
The protesters urged the government to invest more in support services and less in the prison network.(ABC News: Joseph Dunstan)
", "Gunditjmara woman Jami Clark, a friend of Ms Calgaret,\u00a0told the protest that, during her time in the prison, she saw a significant contrast between the humanity of her fellow inmates and the way the system was operated.", "\"They don't care,\" she told the protest.\u00a0\"All they care about is their ticked boxes and their bottom\u00a0lines. They don't know any of our stories.", "\"Since I've been in the system, which has been pretty much all of my whole life, all I've been seeing is who the bad guy is:\u00a0[it's]\u00a0the system.\"", "", "
Police officers supervised the small protest held outside the prison last week.(Supplied: Charandev Singh)
", "Correct Care Australasia provides the onsite primary health services across Victoria's public prison and youth justice centres, as well as the privately run Ravenhall Correctional Centre and the Rivergum Residential Treatment Centre.", "A government spokesperson said the Department of Justice and Community Safety regularly reviewed services \"to ensure every prisoner has access to appropriate health care of a quality and standard equivalent to that provided in the community through the public health system\".", "Correct Care's current contract is due to expire in June, 2023, and a tender process is due to to begin in early 2022."]
